ru.simplefuzzy

Class FuzzyFunc

  • java.lang.Object
    • ru.simplefuzzy.FuzzyFunc

  • public class FuzzyFunc
extends java.lang.Object
    Describes membership function.

    The function can be one of 3 kinds: trapezium, bell function or sigmoid. Type of created function depends on the number of constructor's arguments and is stored in type variable.

    Since:
    0.1
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Timofey
    See Also:
    {@link ru.simplefuzzy.Fuzzy}, {@link ru.simplefuzzy.FuzzyTerm}

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FuzzyFunc(double a, double b)
      Constructs a new sigmoid function.
      FuzzyFunc(double a, double b, double c)
      Constructs a new bell-curved function.
      FuzzyFunc(double entry, double startMax, double endMax, double exit)
      Constructs a new trapezium membership function.

      double getMedian()
      Calculates a point that will be used to determine a mass-center

    • Constructor Detail

      • FuzzyFunc

        public FuzzyFunc(double entry,
                 double startMax,
                 double endMax,
                 double exit)
        Constructs a new trapezium membership function.
        Parameters:
        entry - defines where left side crosses x-axis
        startMax - defines where left sides reaches its maximum
        endMax - defines where function's maximum ends; can be equal to startMax
        exit - defines where right side crosses x-axis
        Since:
        0.1

      • FuzzyFunc

        public FuzzyFunc(double a,
                 double b)
        Constructs a new sigmoid function.
        Parameters:
        a - defines 'wideness' of the function
        b - defines where is a center of the function
        Since:
        0.1

      • FuzzyFunc

        public FuzzyFunc(double a,
                 double b,
                 double c)
        Constructs a new bell-curved function.
        Parameters:
        a - defines 'wideness' of the function
        b - defines sharpness of the edges
        c - defines where is a center of a function
        Since:
        0.1
